intro: Galatella amani, commonly known as the Amani galatella, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats and produces small, daisy-like flowers that are yellow in color. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its native range. Galatella amani is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its habitat.
